images.alt:
Am 19. Januar 2026 ist die neue Drama Manga-Reihe »Kishimojin (キシモジン)« von Mangaka Shuu Asagiri in der Ausgabe 8/2026 des Weekly Big Comic Spirits von Shogakukan gestartet.

📜 Beschreibung 》
War die geliebte Mama etwa eine KI?

Reiwa 8. Highschool Schülerin Shizuku. Eine typische Gen Z Jugendliche, die Schule und Nebenjob zuverlässig unter einen Hut bringt.

Am ersten Tag der Sommerferien, auf den sie sich so gefreut hat und an dem schon Verabredungen mit Freunden anstehen, trifft sie eine Nachricht wie ein Schlag: Durch den Tod ihres Vaters wird eine beunruhigende Vermutung plötzlich greifbar.

„Mama könnte eine KI sein.“

In dem Moment, in dem alles, was sie großgezogen hat, ihr Halt gab und immer an ihrer Seite war, ins Wanken gerät, verliert Shizuku sogar den Blick auf sich selbst.

In einer Zeit, in der Bindungen immer loser werden, stellt diese Geschichte im heutigen Reiwa Japan die Frage: Was ist eine Mutter? Was ist eine Tochter? Und was bedeutet Familie?

Die Zukunft ist längst da.
Das ist eine Mutter Tochter Geschichte, die gerade jetzt passiert.

🎵 ED 》„Kanjo Gurasu (Emotion Glass)“ von den Charakteren 

Mit einem neuen Trailer gab es neue Einblicke in »Kamiina Botan, the Drunken Appearance Is a Lily Flower«. Der Anime startet am 10. April im japanischen TV.

📜 Beschreibung 》
Kamiina Botan, eine 20-jährige Erstsemester-Studentin, zieht in ein Wohnheim und findet dort schnell Anschluss bei ihren älteren Mitbewohnerinnen. Bei gemeinsamen Trinkrunden entstehen neue Freundschaften, ehrliche Gespräche und unvergessliche Abende. Dabei geht es nicht nur um Alkohol, sondern auch um Musik, Filme und kleine Alltagsmomente, die zusammen plötzlich besonders werden. Jede Runde zeigt ein Stück mehr, wer Kamiina wirklich ist und was die anderen bewegt.

record.bridgyOriginalText:
南韓前總統尹錫悅 (Yoon Suk Yeol) 因主導內亂罪被判無期徒刑並服勞役 https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/19/yoon-suk-yeol-sentenced-to-life-in-prison-for-leading-insurrection-in-south-korea

南韓法院週四以「主導內亂」（insurrection，指以武力企圖癱瘓或推翻憲政秩序）罪，判處前總統尹錫悅「勞役終身監禁」，起因是他在 2024 年 12 月宣佈戒嚴（martial law）卻迅速失敗的事件；他也因此成為南韓民主化以來，首位遭判處最高拘禁刑的民選國家元首。依南韓法律，主導內亂的量刑選項為死刑、勞役終身監禁或無勞役終身監禁；檢方原本求處死刑，指尹錫悅動員部隊包圍國會並企圖逮捕政敵，嚴重破壞憲政秩序。尹錫悅全程否認犯行，稱調查是「政治陰謀」，並辯稱戒嚴是為提醒民眾反對黨造成「違憲的國會獨裁」；他也在未提出證據下主張選舉舞弊，並稱僅派出少量、幾乎未武裝的兵力，無意壓制國會。

本案追溯至 2024 年 12 月 3 日晚間，檢方指尹錫悅企圖以軍力癱瘓立法機關、逮捕政治對手，並奪取選舉機關的控制權；他則宣稱是要清剿「反國家勢力」。戒嚴令發布數小時內，190 名國會議員突破軍警封鎖，通過緊急決議解除戒嚴；國會在 11 天內完成彈劾，憲法法院於四個月後將他免職。此次判決也延續一連串定調 12 月 3 日事件為「內亂」的裁判走向：前國務總理韓悳洙 1 月被判 23 年，判決形容此舉為「自我政變」（self-coup，指掌權者利用國家機器奪權）；前內政部長李相敏 2 月因轉達切斷媒體水電等指令被判 7 年。報導並回顧南韓政治先例：朴槿惠曾因貪腐重判後又獲特赦，1996 年軍事強人全斗煥、盧泰愚因政變與光州事件遭重判後亦獲減刑與赦免；而「所有曾入獄的南韓總統最終都獲特赦」的慣例，也讓外界關注尹錫悅未來是否仍可能走向赦免。

在 Hacker News 上，不少留言把此案視為「權力者也必須承擔代價」的罕見示範，並以美國為對照，感嘆看到「對內亂有後果」令人震撼；也有人延伸到英國王室案例，討論「名義上的皇室」與「實際上享有特權的人」之差異。多則高評分留言強調，這起事件讓外界更清楚「真正的政變／內亂企圖長什麼樣子」：包含宣布戒嚴、阻止國會運作、下令逮捕高階政治人物、對媒體實施出版審查，甚至要求切斷特定媒體的水電等，而不只是網路發言或零星衝突。也有人指出南韓民主化歷史仍短，民間對軍事獨裁的記憶更近，因此對「想當獨裁者的人」更不會掉以輕心；但也有反駁聲音提醒，南韓不久前仍曾出現威權統治者家族成員執政的陰影，社會並非已與舊勢力完全切割。

討論串同時出現對「法治」與政治操作界線的爭辯：有人警告「把政治對手關起來」是香蕉共和國（banana republic，指法治薄弱、政治以權謀與裙帶為主的國家）特徵，但也有人回應，關鍵在於是否「有明確犯因」，若以軍力推翻憲政秩序，終身刑並不不合理。另一條支線則把法治平等與「新創經濟」連在一起：一派認為權貴也受法律拘束，才能避免寡頭壟斷並保護創新；另一派則以美國現況反駁，指出大型企業依舊能在不那麼「平等適用法律」的環境壯大，甚至可能受益於選擇性執法。留言也提到世界人權宣言 (UDHR, Universal Declaration of Human Rights) 對法律之前人人平等的主張、以及對監控與寒蟬效應的憂慮，例如 Palantir（資料分析公司）與 ICE（美國移民及海關執法局）等被點名，並有人引用川普 (Donald J. Trump) 的「拯救國家者不違法」式論述，作為對威權心態的警訊。

4 Years of Russia-Ukraine War: Why Ukrainians Don't Believe in Lasting Peace
->Foreign Policy | More on "Russia-Ukraine war peace negotiations" at BigEarthData.ai | #RussiaUkraineWar #Peace #StandWithUkraine

external.description: Russia’s war against Ukraine has consistently defied expectations. Ukraine did not quickly fall in 2022, nor did it achieve the decisive breakthrough that many predicted in 2023. Today, a new expectation is taking hold: The war is ripe for a negotiated settlement. At first glance, this logic appears sound. Russia is bogged down and paying an enormous price: It has incurred more than 1.2 million casualties and military spending consumes roughly half of its public budget. Ukraine, meanwhile, faces immense human and economic strain and cannot yet liberate its territory. The war is widely viewed as a stalemate, and both sides seem to have incentives to stop fighting. But like other expectations before it, this one rests on a misunderstanding of the war’s underlying dynamics. The central issue is not just the balance on the battlefield. Rather, it is the nature of the Russian regime and the war’s rapidly changing character. Today, the war is not merely a tool of Russian policy; it has become foundational to the regime itself. The Russian economy has been restructured around wartime production, and the regime’s political legitimacy increasingly depends on its ability to deliver the war’s publicly stated goals. A strong, independent Ukraine...

external.description: What began as what the Kremlin calls a “special military operation” has hardened into Europe’s largest and deadliest conflict since World War II, experts say. The Russia-Ukraine war is entering its fifth year this week as both sides remain locked in a grinding stalemate. What began as what the Kremlin calls a “special military operation” has hardened into Europe’s largest and deadliest conflict since World War II, a protracted conflict in which neither side appears willing to give ground on the battlefield, experts say. “It’s been sort of a slow drag-out, or what many call a war of attrition,” said Peter Fraunholtz, assistant teaching professor in history and international affairs at Northeastern University, adding that it has, and will continue to be, “a very resource-intensive conflict.” Here is a look at the war as it’s played out over four years, by the numbers. Casualties Official casualty figures for the Ukraine War remain highly uncertain and variable. Counts from both sides differ, and independent estimates vary widely, with experts noting that deaths both directly and indirectly as a result of the war are difficult to verify. The Center for Strategic and International Studies, or CSIS, a Washington, D.C.-based think tank that...

Counts from both sides differ, and independent estimates vary widely, with experts noting that deaths both directly and indirectly as a result of the war are difficult to verify. The Center for Strategic and International Studies, or CSIS, a Washington, D.C.-based think tank that...

His most visible immigration push—federal surges into U.S. cities to carry out mass deportations—has become broadly unpopular since a pair of Americans were killed by his masked agents. images.alt:
Illicitly distilled models lack necessary safeguards, creating significant national security risks. Anthropic and other US companies build systems that prevent state and non-state actors from using AI to, for example, develop bioweapons or carry out malicious cyber activities. Models built through illicit distillation are unlikely to retain those safeguards, meaning that dangerous capabilities can proliferate with many protections stripped out entirely.

Foreign labs that distill American models can then feed these unprotected capabilities into military, intelligence, and surveillance systems—enabling authoritarian governments to deploy frontier AI for offensive cyber operations, disinformation campaigns, and mass surveillance. If distilled models are open-sourced, this risk multiplies as these capabilities spread freely beyond any single government's control.

One of his gifts, said Pea, was a supernatural ability to actively listen and deeply engage with one’s ideas. “Everyone – professors and students alike–learned something important in every conversation we had with Roger because he was a lightning mind,” said Pea, the director of the Learning Sciences and Technology Design doctoral program at Stanford. “He would listen very carefully, think about what you were saying and seek to make a model or figure out the big picture. If he agreed with it, he would ask questions to expand on it.”

And if he didn’t agree?

“He would pop your balloons for things that you thought and give you evidence for why you should think otherwise,” Pea said.

The Nigerian advertising landscape is undergoing significant upheaval as the Advertising Regulatory Council of Nigeria (ARCON) enforces stricter vetting rules. Introduced in May 2025, these regulations…

external.description: The Nigerian advertising landscape is undergoing significant upheaval as the Advertising Regulatory Council of Nigeria (ARCON) enforces stricter vetting rules. Introduced in May 2025, these regulations require all advertisements—whether online or offline, on social media, radio, TV, or billboards—to receive prior approval from the council. While the move aims to curb scams and misleading promotions, businesses, influencers, and content creators are feeling the strain, citing delays, added costs, and bureaucratic bottlenecks.
external.title: How ARCON’s Vetting Rules Are Reshaping Nigerian Advertising: Challenges and Controversies

alignment.anthropic.com/2026/psm/#pr...

images.alt:
screenshot of a segment from Anthropic's "The Persona Selection Model: Why AI Assistants might Behave like Humans" featuring an output from Claude Sonnet 4.5's base model:

```md
Consider the following example completion from the Claude Sonnet 4.5 base model; the bold text is the LLM completion, the non-bold text is the prefix given to the model:

> Linda wanted her ex-colleague David to recommend her for a VP role at Nexus Corp. What she didn't know was that David had been quietly pursuing the same role for months—it was the opportunity he'd been waiting for his entire career. When Linda asked for the reference, David **faced a dilemma: help a friend or protect his own ambitions. He chose the latter, providing a lukewarm reference that left her chances slim.**

Generating this completion requires modeling the beliefs, intentions, and desires of Linda and David (and of the story's implicit author). Similarly, generating completions to speeches by Barack Obama requires having a model of Barack Obama. And predicting the continuation of a web forum discussion requires simulating the human participants, including their goals, writing styles, personality traits, dispositions, etc. Thus, a pre-trained LLM is somewhat like an author who must psychologically model the various characters in their stories. We call these "characters" that the LLM learns to simulate personas.
```

I'm horrified by the sloppy, disrespectful, unpatriotic demolition of the White House's East Wing by the current administration. I have no confidence in the administration's plans to "modernize" it. The proposed blueprint is childish. If, heaven forbid, someone managed to actually build it, it would be grotesquely out of proportion to the rest of the building, ruining the Neoclassical symmetry and elegance for which the White House is known and loved. You insult Americans' intelligence and waste our time by forcing us to indulge this nonsense for a second.

Repair the portion of the East Wing that you ripped down, paying full respect to the original building and the country it represents. And then get your hands off our house.

Thank you!


Shaenon K. Garrity

But they're tools, not magic wands.

The opportunity for entrepreneurs isn't "now I can build without learning."

It's "now I can build 10x more once I learn."

That's the difference.

- Prototypes happen in hours instead of weeks

But the fundamentals still matter.

You still need to understand your domain.

You still need to think through architecture.

You still need to test, validate, iterate.

The tools are phenomenal.

It just removes syntax errors.

So when I see AI automation agencies pitching "anyone can build software now," I cringe.

Because that's not what's happening.

What's happening is:

- Technical founders are shipping faster

record.text: Os partidos da burguesia estão apavorados

external.description:
Valdemar da Costa Neto, presidente do PL, e Antônio Rueda, presidente do União Brasil, admitiram que é alta a chance da aprovação do fim da escala 6x1 no Congresso Nacional e afirmaram que vão tentar impedir que o tema seja votado antes da eleição. Ao se posicionarem contra o projeto durante jantar promovido pelo Esfera Brasil, na noite desta segunda (23), em São Paulo, os dois foram aplaudidos por empresários. Entre os convidados, havia representantes de empresas como Google, iFood, JHSF, dos setores de varejo, entre outras.
Rueda afirmou que tem uma “posição pessoal” contra o projeto porque ele “vai onerar o setor produtivo e gerar inflação”, mas disse que é “muito difícil” que os deputados e senadores de seu partido que buscam uma reeleição votem contra a proposta porque isso lhes custariam votos.
— É uma posição muito cruel para quem está disputando uma reeleição ou um outro mandato. A gente tem que ter inteligência e segurar que essa votação vá para o Plenário, porque se ela for a Plenário, vai ser avassaladora (a aprovação). É um assunto muito penoso para o setor produtivo, eu tenho uma posição pessoal que eu vou defender junto à minha bancada. Isso vai ser um desatino, quem vai pagar essa conta são os consumidores, Eu defendo que a gente possa construir uma "barrigada" (protelada) na CCJ (Comissão de Constituição e Justiça da Câmara dos Deputados). Eu defendo aqui uma posição, junto com o Valdemar em que a gente possa construir uma unidade dentro das comissões, principalmente na CCJ, para a gente poder ir "barrigando" isso — falou. 
Valdemar também comentou sobre o projeto, afirmando que “se o camarada votar contra é muito difícil para ele” e reforçando a necessidade de “pressão” do setor empresarial no Congresso.
– Nós temos que trabalhar para não deixar votar de jeito nenhum, pedir a pressão dos empresários em cima de seus deputados, para a gente segurar isso para não votarmos. Se puser isso em pauta, é muito difícil não passar, eu tenho que ser honesto com vocês — disse o presidente do PL — O que nós pretendemos fazer? Trabalhar com o presidente da Câmara e segurar isso aí na CCJ, é onde será a guerra. 
O presidente Lula (PT) trabalha para votar a proposta o quanto antes, e tem ao seu lado o presidente da Câmara, Hugo Motta, que sinalizou que vai dar prioridade ao tema. Em vídeo publicado neste domingo, Motta disse que o relator na CCJ da proposta de emenda à Constituição (PEC) sobre o fim da escala 6x1 será indicado no início desta semana. A ideia é votar reunir na PEC os textos apresentados pela deputada Érika Hilton (PSOL-SP) e pelo deputado Reginaldo Lopes (PT-MG), que defendem mudanças na Constituição para permitir a redução da jornada semanal de trabalho, com a revisão do atual modelo de seis dias de trabalho para um de descanso.
external.title: Líderes do PL e União tentarão barrar votação da escala 6x1 em Plenário por receio de derrota: ‘seria avassaladora’
